intro: Peucedanum hissaricum, commonly known as the Hissar wormwood, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root system is fibrous, and the plant is often found in rocky or arid environments. It is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
